title: Junior Account Officer Job at Secom Limited
content:
Secom Limited was established as a financial services company. It began as a financial service company with steadfast commitment to exceptional customer service, and overtime, has grown into a leading professional Company in Nigerian. Secom is a diverse and innovative company able to handle large scale transactions and also manage such operations seamlessly.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Account Officer

Job Location: Okota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Complying with all company, local, state, and federal accounting and financial regulations
	Compiled, analyzed, and reported financial data.
	Creating periodic reports, such as balance sheets, profit & loss statements, etc.
	Presenting data to managers, investors, and other entities.
	Maintaining accurate financial records.
	Performing audits and resolving discrepancies.
	Computing taxes.
	Keeping informed about current legislation relating to finance and accounting.
	Assisting management in the decision-making process by preparing budgets and financial forecasts.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in accounting or a related field.
	1-2 years of experience as an accountant
	More education or experience may be preferred.
	Strong analytical, communication, and computer skills.
	Understanding of mathematics, accounting, and financial processes.
	Ethical behavior.
	Attention to detail.


Salary
N150,000 gross Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: resume@secomltd.comusing the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Quality Assurance Engineer Job at Renmoney
content:
Renmoney - We are a passionate team determined to challenge the status quo and make financial inclusion count for the millions of under-banked individuals and small business owners in Nigeria. We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality Assurance Engineer

Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assure the process for contracting software is adequate
	Perform acceptance testing on the software
	Analyze and define existing business processes and interdependencies.
	Analyze functional specs for completeness & test ability.
	Define and document test strategies and scripts based on functional specs.
	Assist in the development and execution of test cases of all complexity and risk.
	Verifies that the application functions according to expected results and system requirements
	Identifies problems, reports defects and test progress
	Analyze test output, identify discrepancies and clearly document defects.
	Ensure requirements are testable.
	Recognize & document issues and propose options for issue resolution.
	Familiar with coding standards and various technologies (PHP, SQL, JAVA, etc.).
	Test Plan/Strategy
	Test scripts (aligned with functional specification)
	IAT Test Report


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a B.Sc. degree in Computer Science or an Information Technology-related course.
	A minimum of 5 years of quality assurance and software testing
	User support experience is desirable
	Knowledge of and experience in the IT Industry is a plus.
	Proficient knowledge of testing tools and processes
	Able to receive and comprehend directions from senior members of the IT/QA team.


Benefits


	You’ll receive competitive compensation and work with amazing people.
	You’ll work in a beautiful environment with a flat structure and solve complex, real-world challenges.

title: Facility / Debt Recovery Officer Job at Confederated Facilitators Limited
content:
Confederated Facilitators Limited (CFL Group) started in 1998 with a company known as Next Technology Nigeria Limited, a telecommunication company that provides internet services for teeming customers. The company was founded by Engr. Lai Omotola. In a space of Nine (9) years, additional 14 companies were added to make up CFL Group as it is known today. In 2015, CFL Group became a full fledge infrastructure company cutting across Real Estate, Energy, Power, Construction, Agriculture and Transportation. We are a fully indigenous Nigeria Company located in Lagos.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Facility / Debt Recovery Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	We are urgently seeking a Facility / Debt Recovery Officer with hands-on experience in property management, particularly within malls, service apartments, or commercial facilities.
	The ideal candidate must possess strong facility management skills, a good understanding of electrical systems, and the ability to handle debt recovery from tenants or clients professionally.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily operations and maintenance of the facility or property.
	Carry out regular inspections of the facility and report faults or necessary repairs.
	Assist in resolving tenant complaints and facility-related issues.
	Work with technical staff or vendors to ensure timely repair and maintenance of electrical systems.
	Monitor service quality, facility cleanliness, and vendor performance.
	Handle recovery of outstanding debts or service charges from tenants.
	Conduct follow-ups via calls, emails, and physical visits to ensure payment compliance.
	Prepare and submit daily and weekly reports to management.
	Ensure compliance with health, safety, and building regulations.


Requirements & Qualifications


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Facility Management, Estate Management, Business Administration, or related fields.
	Minimum of 2 years of experience in facility management, especially in malls, estates, or commercial properties.
	Experience in debt recovery or customer relations is a strong advantage.
	Basic electrical knowledge and the ability to oversee simple repairs.
	Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet recovery targets.
	Must be proactive, organized, and detail-oriented.


Salary
N170,000 - N200,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobs@cflgrouponline.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
